meanings.definition: (Latin) to beat, strike, lash; to whip; to thrash
meanings.english_definition: (Latin) to beat, strike, lash; to whip; to thrash

etymology.value: From Proto-Italic *werberō, from Proto-Indo-European *wer- (“to turn, bend”). Cognate with Ancient Greek ῥάβδος (rhábdos, “rod, stick”), Old English warp (“that which is thrown, a cast net”), and Old High German werfan (“to throw, cast”).

usage_notes.explanation: Verberare is a Latin verb meaning to beat, strike, lash, whip, or thrash. It is used to describe physical acts of striking or whipping.
